timeline.message:
JDT LS tests fail randomly

Signed-off-by: Snjezana Peco <snjezana.peco@redhat.com>

JDT LS tests fail randomly

Signed-off-by: Snjezana Peco <snjezana.peco@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText: I'd rather prefer we kept those temporary files under the target/ dir
timeline.author: fbricon

timeline.bodyText: I'd like to know why exactly this is happening. Is it expected we get multiple calls?
timeline.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText: I tried to run org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core.internal.handlers.ClasspathUpdateHandlerTest.testClasspathUpdateForMaven locally(on Mac and Windows) and the invocation times is always one. wired... 🤔
replies.author: jdneo

replies.bodyText:
You can try the following:
$ rm -rf ~/.m2/repository/org/apache/commons/commons-lang3
$ mvn clean verify
replies.author: snjeza

timeline.bodyText: need to also call WrapperValidator.clear() in setProperty(), as previous Gradle tests might have mutated  WrapperValidator's state
timeline.author: fbricon

timeline.bodyText: I saw this fail if WrapperValidator.clear() is not set in setProperty()
timeline.author: fbricon

timeline.bodyText: needs some comments to explain why this is necessary
timeline.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText: m2e updates a classpath when downloading a source artifact. Jenkins starts with an empty maven repository.
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText: the comments should be added to the code
replies.author: fbricon
